meanings.sent1: Playing outside in the mud can easily smirch your clothes.
meanings.sent2: The rain smirches the windows, making it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy smirches the clean floor with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions smirch his reputation in the community.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist smirches the pristine wall with colorful paint.

meanings.definition: A stain or mark on something
meanings.sent1: She noticed a smirch on her favorite dress after the party.
meanings.sent2: The old book had smirches on its pages from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The smirch on the mirror looked like a tiny heart, oddly enough.
meanings.sent4: The smirch on the painting seemed to follow you wherever you stood.
meanings.sent5: The smirch on the map made it difficult to read the directions.
